content.question: Monopolistically competitive firms are inefficient because they

choices.label: produce a lower level of output at a higher average cost than do perfectly competitive firms
use production processes that are more capital-intensive than do perfectly competitive firms
face downward-sloping demand curves, ensuring that marginal revenue is greater than average revenue
produce at that level of output where price equals marginal cost

content.answer: produce a lower level of output at a higher average cost than do perfectly competitive firms
